summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 7139, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Harrison Street, in the City of Seattle, from Third Avenue North to Fourth Avenue West, by sidewalking, crosswalking, curbing, guttering and parking the same in conformity with plans therefor and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said City, approved December 6, 1899.,
